description: Named after 17th-century Flemish painter Anthony van Dyck.

entries.meaning: An edge with ornamental triangular points.
A style of facial hair which has both a mustache and goatee but with all cheek hair shaven.
A style of dress or collar similar to those in Anthony van Dyck's portrait paintings; a small round cape, the border ornamented with points and indentations.

verbs.description: vandyke (third-person singular simple present vandykes, present participle vandyking, simple past and past participle vandyked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To fit or furnish with a vandyke; to form with points or scallops like a vandyke.
